intro: Eleutherine plicata, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, rounded bulbs underground. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Eleutherine plicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
